alert.note: Alert for Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 9:05PM EST until March 08 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Wabash River at Riverton. Wabash River at Montezuma. Wabash River at Covington. Wabash River at Lafayette. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Wabash River at Terre Haute. Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site. Wabash River at Clinton. .Rainfall amounts of one and one and a half to over three inches earlier last week brought lowland flooding to the Wabash River. With more rain in the forecast over the next few days, these conditions could persist into the middle of next week or longer in some locations. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY, MARCH 08... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday, March 08. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Extensive lowland flooding is in progress. High water surrounds many river cabins. Access to most river cabins is by boat only. Levees begin to protect farmland. Extensive flooding of Leaverton Park occurs in Palestine, Illinois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday /8:00 PM EST Sunday/ the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Sunday /8:00 PM EST Sunday/ was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.4 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, March 07. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
